column4: what about just deleting the .gnome and .gnome2 directories from my profile?
Try to create a new user on the console and login with a gnome session. <ctrl><alt><f1>login ... then sudo adduser gnometest ...  then sudo /etc/init.d/gdm restart && exit
thanks, I'll try that.
If this works you can rename your /home directory and login with a clean gnome session.
would I then copy everything back again to the "new" home directory afterwards?
Well you can copy your files and some of your .conf directories like .mozilla or so. But not the .gnome .gnome2 directories ;)
Normally ... yes.
or my home directory at least...
these are not the only possibilities for your problem ;)
I would rather rename your /home/yourname directory to /home/yourname-old ... then create a new directory /home/yourname ;)
true. call me lazy, but the idea of copying across all the .config directories is not driving me wild ;)
Do what you want. My experience shows, that to start with a clean home directory is sometimes a quiet good idea...
